string.text: A set of tutorials for the GAMMA EXP Edition Redux modlist

All profiles in %c[d_purple]GAMMA EXP Edition Redux%c[white] use %c[d_purple]Dynahud%c[white] as the dynamic hud framework 
 
 The HUD reskin installed is called %c[d_purple]Custom HUD%c[white], a pure immersive hud reskin 
 
 All hud elements are hidden most of the time unless a context arise to show them 
 
 The hud elements are 
 
 %c[d_blue]Status Indicators%c[white] (left/bottom), 
 %c[d_blue]BHS HUD%c[white] (left), 
 %c[d_blue]Main HUD%c[white] (center/bottom), 
 %c[d_blue]Dynamic Compass%c[white] (right), 
 %c[d_blue]Magazine HUD%c[white] (right), 
 %c[d_blue]Companions HUD%c[white] (right), 
 %c[d_blue]Weapon HUD%c[white] (center) 
 
 You can change the rules by which the elements are shown in the Dynahud MCM menu, see further on.

The %c[d_purple]BHS HUD%c[white] configured in Dynahud MCM is the Hybrid mode 
 
 In the view HUD, the BHS HUD is text based. Limb status is shown with a colored LABEL 
 
 White= fine, 
 %c[0,250,250,0]Yellow%c[white]= scratched, 
 %c[d_orange]Orange%c[white]= minor damage, 
 %c[d_red]Red%c[white]= serious damage, 
 %c[ui_gray_2]Grey%c[white]= destroyed 
 
 Opening the inventory, the BHS HUD is shown with a doll instead. This is to visually help medication of the limbs 
 
 You can change the type of BHS HUD in the Dynahud MCM menu.

Use the %c[d_purple]Dynahud%c[white] MCM menu to configure the behavior of the HUD 
 
 In %c[d_blue]Dynamic Main HUD%c[white]you can change the behavior of the status bars (hp, psy and stamina) 
 For instance, set the threshold to the value by which the bar will be always visible 
 
 In %c[d_blue]Dynamic BHS HUD%c[white] you can change several aspects of the BHS HUD, including a choice of three modes 
 
 In %c[d_blue]Dynamic Minimap%c[white], you can change whether the minimap is shown when you equip your weapons or not 
 
 In %c[d_blue]Dynamic Status Icons HUD%c[white], you can change how long the status indicators stays on or when to hide the timers 
 
 In %c[d_blue]Dynamic Companion HUD%c[white], you can change the time the way the companion hud is displayed 
 
 In %c[d_blue]Dynamic Weapon HUD%c[white], you can enable/disable both ammo check and fire mode check at the same time 
 
 In %c[d_blue]Dynamic Magazine HUD%c[white], you can change the way the weapon magazine HUD triggers 
 
 More in each submenus and options within.

One of your limb is completely damaged, you cannot run, aim, and you might limp and walk very slow because of it 
 
 The broken limb is shown on the BHS HUD with a %c[ui_gray_2]Grey%c[white] label (only Text BHS or Hybrid) and in the BHS doll with a completely %c[d_red]red%c[white] bar 
 
 Such injuries can be fatal in a fight 
 
 broken arms makes aiming with guns very hard 
 
 while broken legs impairs your movement with limping and greatly reduced speed 
 
 on %c[d_blue]torso%c[white] and %c[d_blue]head%c[white] such drastic injuries means instant %c[d_red]death%c[white] 
 
 Therefore, it is preferible to delay as much as possible this outcome, by healing up the damaged limbs with painkillers before it's too late

You can restore the limb using medical supplies and the following procedure: 
 
 %c[d_blue]Surgical Kit%c[white] 
 First you need to treat the wound with a surgical kit or instruments 
 The UI will reflects this with the limb label turning to %c[d_purple]purple%c[white] and the bar being filled with a %c[d_blue]blue%c[white] streak 
 
 %c[d_blue]Splint%c[white] 
 Next, secure the limb with a splint 
 The UI will reflect this with the limb indicator turning to %c[d_red]red%c[white] and the limb bar being filled with a white streak again. 
 This simply indicates that the limb can be healed again with medicines or by sleeping. 
 
 There are other ways to restore limbs, like Surgical Instruments or a visit to the %c[d_green]doctor%c[white]

Use a %c[d_blue]painkiller%c[white] to speed up the healing process 
 
 %c[d_blue]Painkillers%c[white] comes with all strenghts but to heal up broken limbs quickly it is recommended %c[d_blue]Yadulin%c[white] 
 
 %c[d_green]Doctors%c[white] and general %c[d_green]traders%c[white] sells medical supplies, although they might charge you considerably 
 
 Similar supplies can also be found carried by other %c[d_green]stalkers%c[white], %c[d_green]stashes%c[white] or in %c[d_green]secured boxes%c[white] 
 %c[d_green]Tasks%c[white] might also give such supplies as rewards. 
 
 Eventually, if you have the resource and the right recipe, you can craft at %c[d_blue]workbenches%c[white] any medical supplies available in the game 
 
 Don't forget, a good night sleep is also an %c[d_green]inexpensive%c[white] way to heal your injuries. 
 
 
 
 %c[d_cyan]Rewards%c[white] 
 
 When you close this tutorial page you will be %c[d_cyan]gifted%c[white] with the supplies to heal your limb now 
 
 check your %c[d_blue]inventory%c[white] and follow the steps as detailed in the previous page
